titleStmt.title: D. S. Goodloe, Hiram Shaw, and John B. Wilgus to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG11927

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 80, Folder 862-91 FAYETTE COUNTY Correspondence 37th Rgt. Ky. Militia

body.p:
EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.
D. S. GOODLOE, Chairman, Lexington
HIRAM SHAW, Lexington.
TUCKER WOODSON, Nicholasville.
J. P. JACKSON, Newport.
J. J. BRADFORD, Augusta.
ROB'T F. BAIRD, Louisville.
J. W. CALVERT, Louisville.
GEO. W. BLACKEY, Bowlinggreen.
THOS. Z. MORROW, Somerset.

HEADQUARTERS
UNION EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE,
Lexington, Ky. July 24 1865.

Hon Thos E Bramlett
Frankfort Kenty
My Dear Sir

Capt Johnson has mustered into the state service Eighty four men -- All for us -- He said they may be disbanded -- We hope you will continue them in sevice at any rates untill after the election -- they are now in camp properly clothen. with garrison equippage

Very Respectfully.
D. S. Goodloe
Hiram Shaw
Jno B Wilgus
Mustering office
